name: Jal Jeera
history: Jal Jeera, a traditional Indian beverage, is popular for its cooling properties and unique taste. The name 'Jal Jeera' literally means 'cumin water' in Hindi. It's a popular summer drink and is also known for aiding digestion.
description: Jal Jeera is a refreshing and tangy Indian drink made primarily with cumin (jeera) and a mix of other herbs and spices. It typically includes mint, tamarind, black salt, and various spices, creating a savory and slightly sour flavor profile.

instructions.title: Roast and Grind Cumin Seeds
instructions.description: Dry roast the cumin seeds until aromatic. Allow them to cool and then grind them into a fine powder.

instructions.title: Blend Spices and Herbs
instructions.description: In a blender, combine the roasted cumin powder, tamarind pulp, mint leaves, black salt, lemon juice, sugar, ginger, and a little water. Blend until smooth.

instructions.title: Strain and Dilute
instructions.description: Strain the mixture into a large jug. Add the remaining water and stir well.

instructions.title: Chill and Serve
instructions.description: Add ice cubes to the Jal Jeera. Serve chilled, garnished with boondi if desired.

tips: Adjust the amount of tamarind and sugar to balance the sourness and sweetness.
Serving it cold enhances its refreshing taste.
variations: For a fizzy version, mix with soda water instead of plain water.
Add different herbs like coriander leaves for a unique flavor.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed fresh. Can be stored in the refrigerator for a day.
storage.instructions: Keep refrigerated and stir well before serving.

presentationTips: Serve in traditional Indian glassware for an authentic experience.
Garnish with a mint sprig or a slice of lemon for added appeal.
